alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 4:54PM EDT until September 05 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT/7 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Panhandle Florida and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in Panhandle Florida, Jackson. In southwest Georgia, Seminole. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT /700 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 PM CDT /453 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Drakes Still, Fairchild, Haynes, Seminole State Park, Lake Seminole, Hornsville, Steam Mill and Riverturn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
